name: Apple Pie
description: A classic dessert with tender cooked apples and a flaky crust.
pregnancy_benefit: A source of quick energy and soluble fiber from the apples, which aids in digestion. Best enjoyed in moderation.
ingredients:
6 large Granny Smith apples
3/4 cup white sugar
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1 package double-crust pie pastry
1 tablespoon butter
instructions_markdown:
Prepare pie crust.
Mix sliced apples with cinnamon and sugar.
Fill crust and bake until golden brown.

name: Baby Back Ribs
description: Pork ribs, slow-cooked or grilled, and coated in a sweet or savory barbecue sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: A high source of protein and Iron. Choose leaner cuts and focus on vegetable-rich side dishes to balance the meal.
ingredients:
2 racks pork baby back ribs
1/4 cup dry spice rub (paprika, garlic powder, onion powder)
1 cup barbecue sauce
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions_markdown:
Slow-cook or smoke ribs until tender.
Coat with barbecue sauce.
Finish on the grill or broiler.

name: Baklava
description: A rich, sweet dessert pastry made of layers of filo pastry filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup or honey.
pregnancy_benefit: A concentrated source of energy for occasional cravings. The nuts provide trace minerals and healthy fats.
ingredients:
1 package phyllo dough
1 pound chopped walnuts or pistachios
1 cup melted butter
1 cup water
1 cup white sugar
1/2 cup honey
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
instructions_markdown:
Layer filo pastry with melted butter and chopped nuts.
Bake until golden and pour hot syrup over the cold pastry.

name: Barbecue Chicken Quesadilla
description: Grilled tortillas filled with chicken, barbecue sauce, and melted cheese.
pregnancy_benefit: Provides protein and calcium. Use whole-wheat tortillas and add diced onions/peppers for extra fiber and vitamins.
ingredients:
2 large flour tortillas
1/2 cup shredded cooked chicken
1/4 cup barbecue sauce
1/2 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese
2 tablespoons diced red onions
instructions_markdown:
Mix cooked chicken with BBQ sauce.
Place chicken and cheese between two tortillas.
Grill until cheese is melted and tortilla is golden.

name: Bean and Bacon Griddle Burritos
description: Portable burritos filled with refried beans, crispy bacon, and cheese, then grilled on a griddle.
pregnancy_benefit: Fiber from the beans aids in digestion, and the protein and carbs provide lasting fullness. Ensure bacon is cooked until crisp.
ingredients:
1 large flour tortilla
1/2 cup refried pinto beans
3 strips cooked crispy bacon
1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1 teaspoon vegetable oil for griddle
instructions_markdown:
Warm a tortilla.
Fill with refried beans, cooked bacon pieces, and shredded cheese.
Roll up and grill until golden brown.

name: Beef Carpaccio
description: Thinly sliced raw beef, often dressed with olive oil, lemon juice, capers, and Parmesan cheese.
pregnancy_benefit: Not recommended for pregnant women due to raw meat. (If consumed, must be flash-frozen first to eliminate parasites.)
ingredients:
4 ounces beef tenderloin
2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
1 tablespoon capers, drained
1 ounce shaved Parmesan cheese
1/2 cup fresh arugula
instructions_markdown:
Thinly slice or pound raw beef tenderloin.
Arrange on a plate and drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Top with capers and arugula.

name: Beef Stroganoff
description: Tender beef slices and mushrooms in a creamy, savory sauce, often served over egg noodles.
pregnancy_benefit: High in Iron and Vitamin B12 from the beef, crucial for energy and red blood cell formation. Serve with whole-wheat noodles.
ingredients:
1 pound beef sirloin, cut into strips
8 ounces sliced mushrooms
1 medium onion, diced
1 cup beef broth
1 cup sour cream
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
1 package egg noodles
instructions_markdown:
Sauté beef strips and mushrooms.
Prepare sauce with beef broth and sour cream.
Combine and serve over noodles.

name: Bibimbap
description: A Korean mixed rice dish topped with seasoned vegetables, meat (optional), and a fried egg.
pregnancy_benefit: A complete, balanced meal with protein from the egg/meat, complex carbs from rice, and a wide variety of vitamins and minerals from the vegetables.
ingredients:
1 cup cooked white rice
1/4 cup sautéed spinach
1/4 cup julienned carrots
1/4 cup sliced zucchini
1 large egg
1 teaspoon sesame oil
1 tablespoon gochujang (Korean chili paste)
instructions_markdown:
Cook and assemble rice, sautéed vegetables (spinach, carrots, zucchini).
Top with a fried egg and a light sesame oil dressing.

name: Bowtie Pasta with Gorgonzola Sauce
description: Pasta tossed in a rich, creamy sauce made with Gorgonzola cheese.
pregnancy_benefit: A satisfying, energy-dense comfort food. Choose hard cheeses like Gorgonzola, which are generally safe during pregnancy.
ingredients:
1 pound bowtie pasta (farfalle)
1 cup heavy cream
4 ounces crumbled Gorgonzola cheese
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
Fresh cracked black pepper
instructions_markdown:
Cook bowtie pasta.
Melt Gorgonzola into a light cream sauce.
Toss with pasta and serve.

name: Breakfast Burrito
description: A satisfying wrap filled with eggs, beans, cheese, and sometimes sausage or potatoes.
pregnancy_benefit: Eggs provide Choline for brain development, and the beans/whole-wheat tortilla offer lasting energy and fiber.
ingredients:
1 whole-wheat tortilla
2 large eggs
1/4 cup canned black beans, rinsed
1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
2 tablespoons fresh salsa
1/4 avocado, sliced
instructions_markdown:
Scramble eggs.
Warm a large tortilla.
Fill with eggs, black beans, salsa, and a sprinkle of cheese.
Wrap tightly.

name: Bruschetta
description: Toasted bread rubbed with garlic and topped with fresh tomatoes, basil, and olive oil.
pregnancy_benefit: Provides a high amount of Vitamin C from the tomatoes. A light and refreshing appetizer.
ingredients:
1 baguette, sliced and toasted
4 large Roma tomatoes, diced
2 cloves garlic, peeled
1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
Salt to taste
instructions_markdown:
Slice and toast bread.
Top with diced tomatoes, garlic, basil, and olive oil.

name: Caesar Salad
description: Romaine lettuce and croutons dressed with Parmesan cheese, lemon juice, olive oil, and sometimes anchovies.
pregnancy_benefit: Romaine lettuce offers Folate and Vitamin K. Ensure dressing is made with pasteurized eggs if eating homemade.
ingredients:
1 large head Romaine lettuce
1/2 cup croutons
1/4 cup shaved Parmesan cheese
1/4 cup pasteurized Caesar dressing
1 tablespoon lemon juice
instructions_markdown:
Toss chopped Romaine lettuce with croutons and shaved Parmesan.
Dress with a light Caesar dressing.

name: Cannoli
description: Italian pastry dessert consisting of tube-shaped fried dough, filled with a sweet, creamy ricotta cheese filling.
pregnancy_benefit: A treat to enjoy in moderation. Ricotta is a good source of Calcium and protein.
ingredients:
8 cannoli shells
2 cups whole milk ricotta cheese, drained
3/4 cup powdered sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 cup mini chocolate chips
1 teaspoon lemon zest
instructions_markdown:
Form and fry pastry dough into shells.
Mix ricotta with sugar and flavorings (vanilla, lemon zest).
Pipe the filling into the cooled shells.

name: Caprese Salad
description: A simple Italian salad made of sliced fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil, seasoned with olive oil.
pregnancy_benefit: Mozzarella provides Calcium, while tomatoes offer Vitamin C. Use pasteurized mozzarella for safety.
ingredients:
2 medium vine-ripened tomatoes, sliced
4 ounces fresh pasteurized mozzarella, sliced
6 fresh basil leaves
1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
1 teaspoon balsamic glaze
Salt and pepper to taste
instructions_markdown:
Arrange slices of fresh mozzarella, tomato, and basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and a dash of balsamic vinegar (optional).

name: Caramelized Pork Tenderloin
description: Pork tenderloin roasted or pan-seared with a sweet, sticky, caramelized glaze.
pregnancy_benefit: Pork tenderloin is one of the leanest meats, offering high protein and B vitamins with minimal fat. Ensure it is cooked thoroughly.
ingredients:
1 pound pork tenderloin
2 tablespoons brown sugar
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon honey
1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 teaspoon ground ginger
instructions_markdown:
Sear pork tenderloin on all sides.
Brush with a caramelizing glaze (sugar, soy sauce, spices).
Roast until cooked through (145°F / 63°C).

name: Carrot Cake
description: A dense cake containing carrots mixed into the batter, often topped with cream cheese frosting.
pregnancy_benefit: Carrots are rich in Beta-Carotene (Vitamin A), important for cell growth. A treat to enjoy with a bit of nutritional value.
ingredients:
2 cups grated carrots
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
3 large eggs
1 cup vegetable oil
1 teaspoon baking soda
8 ounces cream cheese (for frosting)
2 cups powdered sugar
instructions_markdown:
Mix dry and wet ingredients with shredded carrots.
Bake cake and let cool.
Frost with cream cheese frosting.

name: Chicken Broccoli Casserole
description: A creamy, baked dish combining chicken, broccoli, rice, and a cheesy sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: A comforting source of Calcium, Folate, and Vitamin C from the broccoli, and high-quality protein from the chicken.
ingredients:
2 cups cooked chicken, shredded
2 cups steamed broccoli florets
2 cups cooked white rice
1 can (10.5 oz) cream of chicken soup
1 1/2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese
1/2 cup milk
instructions_markdown:
Combine cooked chicken, rice, and steamed broccoli.
Mix with a creamy soup or cheese sauce.
Bake until bubbly.

name: Chicken Fajitas
description: Sizzling strips of chicken and bell peppers seasoned and served with warm tortillas and toppings.
pregnancy_benefit: Excellent source of lean protein and high amounts of Vitamin C from the bell peppers, which supports the immune system.
ingredients:
1 pound chicken breast, sliced into strips
2 large bell peppers, sliced
1 large onion, sliced
8 small corn tortillas
1 tablespoon cumin
1 tablespoon chili powder
1 lime, juiced
instructions_markdown:
Season and sauté chicken and sliced bell peppers/onions.
Serve with warmed corn or whole-wheat tortillas and fresh salsa.

name: Chicken Parm Sandwich
description: Breaded chicken cutlet topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese on a roll.
pregnancy_benefit: A substantial meal providing protein and calcium. Use whole-wheat rolls and baked chicken to improve health profile.
ingredients:
1 breaded chicken cutlet, cooked
1 large hoagie roll
1/2 cup marinara sauce
2 slices mozzarella cheese
1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese
instructions_markdown:
Bread and cook chicken cutlet.
Place on a roll, top with marinara and cheese.
Broil until cheese is melted.

name: Chicken Quesadillas
description: Flour tortillas filled with shredded chicken and melted cheese, griddled until golden.
pregnancy_benefit: Quick and easy source of protein and calcium. Serve with salsa and avocado for Vitamin C and healthy fats.
ingredients:
2 flour tortillas
1/2 cup cooked shredded chicken
1/2 cup shredded Mexican blend cheese
1 tablespoon butter for pan
instructions_markdown:
Fill tortillas with shredded cooked chicken and cheese.
Cook in a pan until cheese is melted and tortilla is crisp.

name: Chicken Satay and Peanut Sauce
description: Marinated, skewered chicken, often grilled, served with a rich peanut dipping sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: Chicken provides lean protein, and the peanut sauce offers healthy fats and Vitamin E (use caution if there are nut allergies).
ingredients:
1 pound chicken breast, skewered
1/2 cup creamy peanut butter
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon lime juice
1 tablespoon brown sugar
1/2 teaspoon curry powder
instructions_markdown:
Marinate and grill chicken on skewers.
Blend peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, and spices for the sauce.
Serve chicken skewers with sauce.

name: Chicken with Spinach and Mushrooms
description: Pan-seared chicken cutlets served in a light cream sauce with fresh spinach and sautéed mushrooms.
pregnancy_benefit: High in Protein, Folate (spinach), and Vitamin D (mushrooms, if UV-treated). A great nutrient-dense, low-carb meal.
ingredients:
2 chicken breasts, pounded thin
2 cups fresh spinach
1 cup sliced mushrooms
1/4 cup heavy cream
1/2 cup chicken broth
1 clove garlic, minced
instructions_markdown:
Cook chicken and set aside.
Sauté mushrooms and spinach in the pan.
Deglaze with broth or wine and add a splash of light cream to make the sauce.
Return chicken to pan.

name: Chocolate Cake
description: A classic, rich, moist cake flavored with cocoa powder.
pregnancy_benefit: A comforting treat that can satisfy cravings. Dark chocolate contains trace minerals like iron and magnesium.
ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 cups granulated sugar
3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
2 large eggs
1 cup whole milk
1/2 cup vegetable oil
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
instructions_markdown:
Prepare chocolate cake batter and bake.
Allow to cool completely.
Frost with chocolate frosting.

name: Cilantro Beef Tacos
description: Soft corn or flour tortillas filled with seasoned ground beef and topped with a fresh cilantro-lime mix.
pregnancy_benefit: Beef provides essential Iron and Zinc. Cilantro is a good source of Vitamin K and antioxidants.
ingredients:
1 pound lean ground beef
1 packet taco seasoning
9 small corn tortillas
1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
1/2 cup white onion, diced
2 limes, cut into wedges
instructions_markdown:
Cook and season ground beef.
Warm tortillas.
Assemble tacos with beef and a topping of cilantro, lime juice, and chopped onion.

name: Clam Chowder
description: A thick, creamy soup traditionally made with clams, potatoes, and onions.
pregnancy_benefit: Provides Iron from the clams and Calcium from the milk/cream base. Choose a version low in sodium.
ingredients:
2 cans (6.5 oz) chopped clams
2 cups diced potatoes
1 cup diced onion
2 cups half-and-half
4 slices bacon, diced
2 tablespoons butter
instructions_markdown:
Cook clams and set aside.
Sauté vegetables, add flour and milk to make a creamy base.
Stir in clams and potatoes and simmer.

name: Club Sandwich
description: A triple-decker sandwich layered with sliced turkey, bacon, lettuce, and tomato.
pregnancy_benefit: Turkey provides lean protein. Use whole-grain bread and fresh vegetables for fiber and vitamins.
ingredients:
3 slices whole-grain bread, toasted
3 ounces sliced turkey breast
3 strips cooked bacon
2 slices tomato
1 leaf iceberg lettuce
1 tablespoon mayonnaise
instructions_markdown:
Toast three slices of bread.
Layer with turkey, cooked bacon, lettuce, tomato, and light mayo.
Cut into quarters.

name: Crab Cakes
description: Patties made from crab meat, bread crumbs, and seasonings, often pan-fried or baked.
pregnancy_benefit: Good source of Vitamin B12 and lean protein. Ensure they are cooked thoroughly and crab is a low-mercury variety.
ingredients:
1 pound lump crab meat
1/2 cup breadcrumbs
1 large egg
1/4 cup mayonnaise
1 teaspoon Old Bay seasoning
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
instructions_markdown:
Mix crab meat, breadcrumbs, egg, and seasoning.
Form into patties and pan-fry or bake until golden.

name: Crescent Turkey Casserole
description: A quick casserole made with cooked turkey, creamy sauce, and topped with flaky crescent roll dough.
pregnancy_benefit: A comforting source of protein. Can be made healthier by incorporating hidden vegetables into the creamy filling.
ingredients:
3 cups cooked turkey, cubed
1 can (10.75 oz) cream of mushroom soup
2 cups mixed vegetables (peas and carrots)
1 tube (8 oz) refrigerated crescent roll dough
1/2 cup milk
instructions_markdown:
Mix cooked turkey, gravy/cream of soup, and vegetables.
Pour into a baking dish.
Top with crescent roll dough and bake until golden brown.

name: Dumplings
description: Savory pockets of dough filled with ground meat and/or vegetables, usually steamed or pan-fried.
pregnancy_benefit: A manageable source of protein and carbohydrates for appetite-challenged days. Ensure meat filling is cooked thoroughly.
ingredients:
1 package dumpling wrappers
1/2 pound ground pork or chicken
1 cup shredded cabbage
1 tablespoon soy sauce
1 teaspoon grated ginger
1 clove garlic, minced
instructions_markdown:
Prepare meat/vegetable filling and dough wrappers.
Fill and seal the dumplings.
Steam or pan-fry until cooked through.

name: Easy Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A simple, comforting pasta dish with a rich meat sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: Meat provides Iron and Zinc, while the tomato sauce is rich in Vitamin C. Use whole-wheat spaghetti for fiber.
ingredients:
1 pound lean ground beef
1 jar (24 oz) marinara sauce
1 pound whole-wheat spaghetti
1 medium onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 teaspoon dried oregano
instructions_markdown:
Brown ground beef or turkey.
Simmer with canned crushed tomatoes, herbs, and seasonings.
Serve over cooked spaghetti.

name: Eggs Benedict
description: An American breakfast dish consisting of an English muffin topped with Canadian bacon, a poached egg, and hollandaise sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: Eggs are a fantastic source of Choline. Ensure the eggs are thoroughly cooked (not runny) or the sauce is made with pasteurized eggs.
ingredients:
1 English muffin, split
2 large eggs
2 slices Canadian bacon
1/4 cup hollandaise sauce (prepared with pasteurized eggs)
1 teaspoon white vinegar (for poaching)
instructions_markdown:
Toast English muffin halves.
Top with Canadian bacon and a poached egg.
Drizzle with hollandaise sauce.

name: Falafel
description: Deep-fried balls or patties made from ground chickpeas and spices.
pregnancy_benefit: A great vegetarian source of Iron and Folate from chickpeas. Choose baked falafel to reduce fat content.
ingredients:
1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained
1/2 cup fresh parsley, chopped
3 cloves garlic
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1/2 cup breadcrumbs
Vegetable oil for frying
instructions_markdown:
Process chickpeas, herbs, and spices.
Form into patties and shallow fry or bake.

name: Filet Mignon
description: A thick, tender cut of steak from the beef tenderloin, often pan-seared or grilled.
pregnancy_benefit: High-quality, lean Protein and Iron. It is critical that the steak is cooked to at least medium-well (160°F / 71°C) during pregnancy.
ingredients:
6 ounce beef tenderloin steak
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 clove garlic, smashed
1 sprig fresh rosemary
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions_markdown:
Season filet mignon generously.
Sear in a hot pan and finish in the oven (or grill) until cooked to desired doneness.

name: Fish and Chips
description: Battered and deep-fried fish fillets served with thick-cut fried potatoes (chips).
pregnancy_benefit: A source of lean protein. Choose fish like Cod or Haddock which are low in mercury. Best enjoyed occasionally due to the deep-frying.
ingredients:
2 fillets white fish (cod or haddock)
1 cup all-purpose flour
1 cup sparkling water or beer
2 large russet potatoes, cut into strips
Vegetable oil for deep frying
Salt and malt vinegar for serving
instructions_markdown:
Dip fish fillets in batter and deep fry.
Fry potato chips until golden.
Serve with malt vinegar and salt.

name: French Fries
description: Deep-fried potato strips, often served as a side.
pregnancy_benefit: Potatoes contain Vitamin C and Potassium. A comfort food that provides quick energy; best enjoyed in moderation or baked.
ingredients:
2 large russet potatoes
1 quart vegetable oil
Sea salt to taste
instructions_markdown:
Slice potatoes into strips.
Soak in cold water, dry thoroughly.
Fry or bake until golden and crispy.

name: French Onion Soup
description: A soup based on beef broth, traditionally topped with croutons and a layer of melted cheese.
pregnancy_benefit: Provides hydration and warm, savory broth, which can be soothing during pregnancy. Onions contain prebiotics for gut health.
ingredients:
4 large yellow onions, sliced
4 cups beef broth
2 tablespoons butter
4 slices French baguette
4 slices Gruyère or Swiss cheese
1/4 cup dry sherry (optional)
instructions_markdown:
Slowly caramelize sliced onions.
Add beef broth and simmer.
Top with bread and cheese, then broil until melted.

name: Fried Rice
description: A Chinese dish of cooked rice stir-fried in a wok or a frying pan, usually mixed with other ingredients like eggs, vegetables, and meat.
pregnancy_benefit: A convenient, balanced meal providing carbs, protein, and vegetables. Ensure the rice is fresh or properly cooled to prevent bacteria growth.
ingredients:
2 cups cooked white rice, chilled
2 large eggs, beaten
1/2 cup frozen peas and carrots
2 green onions, sliced
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon sesame oil
instructions_markdown:
Stir-fry eggs and set aside.
Stir-fry vegetables (peas, carrots) and meat/tofu.
Add day-old cooked rice and soy sauce; stir-fry until heated through.

name: Glass Noodle Stir Fry
description: Clear mung bean noodles stir-fried with vegetables and meat/seafood, known for its light texture.
pregnancy_benefit: A low-fat, high-volume meal. Glass noodles are easy to digest, and the dish can be loaded with colorful vegetables for nutrients.
ingredients:
4 ounces glass noodles (cellophane noodles)
1/2 pound shrimp or chicken strips
1 cup shredded cabbage
1/2 cup bell pepper strips
2 tablespoons oyster sauce
1 tablespoon soy sauce
instructions_markdown:
Soak glass noodles until pliable.
Stir-fry desired vegetables and protein.
Add noodles and sauce; cook until sauce is absorbed.

name: Gnocchi with White Beans
description: Soft potato gnocchi tossed with cannellini beans, kale, and a light garlic-herb sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: A good source of complex carbohydrates and plant-based Fiber and Folate from the beans and kale.
ingredients:
1 pound potato gnocchi
1 can (15 oz) cannellini beans, rinsed
2 cups chopped kale
3 cloves garlic, minced
2 tablespoons olive oil
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
instructions_markdown:
Cook gnocchi until floating.
Sauté garlic, onions, and kale.
Toss gnocchi and white beans with the sautéed vegetables and season.

name: Greek Chicken Pasta
description: Pasta tossed with grilled chicken, feta cheese, olives, and fresh Mediterranean vegetables.
pregnancy_benefit: Lean protein, calcium from feta, and heart-healthy monounsaturated fats from olive oil and olives.
ingredients:
1 pound penne pasta
2 grilled chicken breasts, sliced
1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
1/2 cup Kalamata olives, pitted
1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil
1 teaspoon dried oregano
instructions_markdown:
Cook pasta.
Combine chicken, pasta, chopped tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta.
Dress with a lemon and herb vinaigrette.

name: Grilled Beef and Blue Cheese Sandwich
description: A sophisticated sandwich featuring thinly sliced grilled beef and pungent blue cheese, often on sourdough.
pregnancy_benefit: Beef provides crucial Iron and Zinc. Ensure the blue cheese used is a hard variety or made with pasteurized milk.
ingredients:
2 slices sourdough bread
4 ounces thinly sliced grilled roast beef
2 tablespoons crumbled blue cheese (pasteurized)
1 tablespoon caramelized onions
1 teaspoon butter
instructions_markdown:
Grill thinly sliced beef.
Spread blue cheese mixture on bread.
Grill the sandwich until cheese is melted and bread is toasted.

name: Hamburger
description: A sandwich consisting of one or more cooked patties of ground meat placed inside a sliced bun.
pregnancy_benefit: Ground beef is a concentrated source of highly absorbable Iron and Zinc. Ensure the patty is cooked thoroughly (no pink).
ingredients:
1/3 pound ground beef (80/20 mix)
1 brioche or whole-wheat bun
1 slice cheddar cheese
1 leaf lettuce
2 slices tomato
1 tablespoon ketchup
instructions_markdown:
Season and grill ground beef patty.
Serve on a whole-wheat bun with lettuce, tomato, and condiments.

name: Homemade Chicken Potpie
description: A classic comfort food: savory chicken and vegetables in a creamy sauce, topped with a flaky pastry crust.
pregnancy_benefit: A warm, comforting meal providing lean protein, Vitamin A (from carrots), and carbohydrates for sustained energy.
ingredients:
1 package double pie crust
2 cups cooked chicken, cubed
1 cup diced carrots
1 cup frozen peas
1/2 cup diced celery
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
2 cups chicken broth
instructions_markdown:
Cook chicken and mix with vegetables and gravy.
Pour filling into a baking dish.
Top with pastry crust and bake until golden.

name: Honey Garlic Pork Chops
description: Pan-seared pork chops finished with a sticky, sweet, and savory honey-garlic glaze.
pregnancy_benefit: Pork is an excellent source of Thiamine (B1) and Niacin (B3), important for energy metabolism. Ensure chops are cooked through (145°F / 63°C).
ingredients:
2 bone-in pork chops
1/4 cup honey
3 cloves garlic, minced
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon olive oil
instructions_markdown:
Pan-sear pork chops until cooked.
Prepare glaze by simmering honey, garlic, and soy sauce.
Coat chops in glaze and serve.

name: Honey Sesame Chicken
description: Crispy chicken pieces tossed in a sweet, sticky honey-sesame sauce, often served with rice.
pregnancy_benefit: A good protein source. Sesame seeds provide trace minerals like copper and manganese. Opt for baked chicken over fried.
ingredients:
1 pound chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
1/4 cup honey
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon sesame oil
1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds
1/2 cup cornstarch (for coating)
instructions_markdown:
Lightly bread and bake chicken pieces.
Toss with a sauce made from honey, sesame oil, and soy sauce.
Garnish with sesame seeds.

name: Hot Dog
description: A grilled or boiled sausage served in a sliced bun, usually topped with condiments.
pregnancy_benefit: A comfort food. Limit consumption due to sodium, and always ensure the sausage is steaming hot to reduce listeria risk.
ingredients:
1 beef or turkey hot dog
1 hot dog bun
1 tablespoon yellow mustard
1 tablespoon sweet pickle relish
instructions_markdown:
Grill or boil the hot dog until steaming hot.
Place in a bun and add desired toppings.

name: Jacket Potato
description: A large potato baked in its skin until soft, then split open and filled with various toppings.
pregnancy_benefit: The skin provides High Fiber and Potassium. Top with lean protein (chili, beans, tuna) and a dollop of yogurt/cheese for calcium.
ingredients:
1 large Russet potato
1/2 cup baked beans
1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1 teaspoon butter
instructions_markdown:
Bake potato until skin is crisp and inside is fluffy.
Split open and fill with desired toppings (e.g., baked beans and cheese).

name: Lasagna
description: Layers of pasta, meat or vegetable sauce, and cheese, baked until bubbly.
pregnancy_benefit: The meat or beans offer protein and iron, while the cheese provides Calcium. A filling meal, great for freezing portions.
ingredients:
12 lasagna noodles, cooked
1 pound ground beef
1 jar (24 oz) marinara sauce
15 ounces ricotta cheese
2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
1/2 cup grated Parmesan
instructions_markdown:
Layer cooked lasagna noodles, meat/veg sauce, ricotta, and mozzarella cheese.
Bake until cheese is melted and browned.

name: Lasagna Cups
description: Individual-sized servings of lasagna baked in a muffin tin for easy portion control.
pregnancy_benefit: A protein and calcium source in a perfect portion size, which is great for managing large appetite or mild heartburn.
ingredients:
12 wonton wrappers or cooked lasagna noodle squares
1 cup meat sauce
3/4 cup ricotta cheese
1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
instructions_markdown:
Line muffin tins with lasagna noodles.
Fill with ricotta mixture, meat sauce, and mozzarella.
Bake until bubbly.

name: Lemony Tortellini Bacon Salad
description: Chilled pasta salad featuring cheese tortellini, crisp bacon, and fresh vegetables in a bright lemon dressing.
pregnancy_benefit: Provides complex carbohydrates and protein. Bacon should be cooked until crisp to reduce nitrates.
ingredients:
1 pound cheese tortellini
6 slices cooked crispy bacon, crumbled
1 cup frozen peas, thawed
1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
1/4 cup olive oil
1 tablespoon lemon zest
instructions_markdown:
Cook and cool tortellini.
Mix with crisp, crumbled bacon and chopped vegetables.
Dress with a lemon vinaigrette.

name: Lobster Bisque
description: A smooth, highly seasoned soup of French origin, classically prepared with lobster stock and cream.
pregnancy_benefit: Lobster is a low-mercury shellfish, providing protein and trace minerals like Copper. Best enjoyed as an occasional treat due to the cream base.
ingredients:
1 pound cooked lobster meat, chopped
1/4 cup butter
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
2 cups lobster or seafood stock
1 cup heavy cream
1/4 cup tomato paste
instructions_markdown:
Sauté vegetables and lobster shells to create a broth.
Blend the broth and stir in heavy cream.
Add cooked lobster meat and season.

name: Macaroni and Cheese
description: Cooked macaroni pasta mixed with a cheese sauce, typically cheddar.
pregnancy_benefit: A comforting food that is an excellent source of Calcium. Use whole-wheat macaroni and add puréed vegetables (like squash) to the sauce for extra nutrients.
ingredients:
8 ounces elbow macaroni
1/4 cup butter
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
2 cups whole milk
2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese
instructions_markdown:
Cook macaroni.
Prepare roux and whisk in milk and cheese to make a sauce.
Combine pasta and sauce, then bake or serve immediately.

name: Massaman Curry
description: A rich, relatively mild Thai curry that is typically made with potatoes, peanuts, and meat (often beef or chicken).
pregnancy_benefit: A well-rounded meal offering protein, carbohydrates, and nutrients from the spices. Great source of healthy fats from coconut milk and peanuts.
ingredients:
1 pound chicken breast or beef, cubed
2 large potatoes, cubed
1 can (13.5 oz) coconut milk
2 tablespoons Massaman curry paste
1/4 cup roasted peanuts
1 onion, sliced
instructions_markdown:
Sauté Massaman curry paste in coconut milk.
Add potatoes, meat, and vegetables; simmer until cooked.
Stir in peanuts before serving with rice.

name: Mediterranean Turkey Skillet
description: A one-pan dish with ground turkey, spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, and Kalamata olives.
pregnancy_benefit: Very high in lean protein and packed with Iron and Folate from the spinach. Olives provide monounsaturated fats.
ingredients:
1 pound ground turkey
4 cups fresh spinach
1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
1/4 cup Kalamata olives, sliced
1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
1 teaspoon dried oregano
instructions_markdown:
Brown ground turkey.
Stir in diced tomatoes, olives, and fresh spinach.
Season with Mediterranean herbs and serve over quinoa or brown rice.

name: Mixed Vegetable Stir Fry
description: An assortment of fresh vegetables quickly cooked in a wok with a light soy-based sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: An excellent way to consume a wide variety of vitamins and antioxidants. High in fiber and low in fat. Add tofu or edamame for protein.
ingredients:
1 cup broccoli florets
1/2 cup sliced carrots
1/2 cup snow peas
1/2 red bell pepper, sliced
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 teaspoon grated ginger
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
instructions_markdown:
Heat oil in a wok.
Stir-fry hard vegetables (broccoli, carrots) first, then softer ones (peppers, snap peas).
Add soy sauce/ginger sauce and stir-fry until vegetables are crisp-tender.

name: Nachos
description: Tortilla chips covered with melted cheese and topped with various ingredients like salsa, jalapeños, and ground meat/beans.
pregnancy_benefit: A fun comfort food. Can be made healthy by adding black beans (protein/fiber) and lots of fresh salsa and avocado (Vitamin C and healthy fats).
ingredients:
1 bag (10 oz) corn tortilla chips
2 cups shredded Mexican blend cheese
1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed
1/2 cup jarred jalapeños
1/2 cup fresh salsa
1/4 cup sour cream
instructions_markdown:
Spread tortilla chips on a tray.
Top with beans, meat (optional), and cheese.
Bake until cheese is melted and serve with fresh toppings.

name: Omelette
description: A dish made from beaten eggs fried with butter or oil, often folded around a filling such as cheese, vegetables, or meat.
pregnancy_benefit: Pure protein and Choline from eggs. Fill with vegetables like spinach and peppers to boost Folate and Vitamin C.
ingredients:
3 large eggs
1 tablespoon milk
1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1/4 cup baby spinach
1 teaspoon butter
instructions_markdown:
Whisk eggs with a splash of water/milk.
Pour into hot, buttered pan; cook until set.
Place fillings (cheese, spinach) on one half and fold.

name: Pad Kra Pao
description: A popular Thai stir-fry featuring meat (often chicken or beef) and basil, served over rice, sometimes with a fried egg.
pregnancy_benefit: Provides quick protein and energy. Basil contains Vitamin K. Ensure it's not overly spicy for sensitive stomachs.
ingredients:
1/2 pound ground chicken
1 cup fresh Thai holy basil leaves
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon fish sauce
1 tablespoon soy sauce
1 teaspoon sugar
1 large egg (optional)
instructions_markdown:
Stir-fry ground meat with garlic, chili, and holy basil leaves.
Season with soy sauce and fish sauce.
Serve immediately over steamed rice.

name: Paella
description: A Spanish rice dish originally from Valencia, typically made with saffron, vegetables, chicken, and seafood (or a combination).
pregnancy_benefit: A source of complex carbohydrates, protein (from seafood/chicken), and healthy fats (from olive oil). Saffron is also a source of manganese.
ingredients:
2 cups Bomba or Arborio rice
1/2 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/2 pound chicken thighs, cubed
4 cups chicken broth
1/2 teaspoon saffron threads
1/2 cup frozen peas
1 red bell pepper, sliced
instructions_markdown:
Sauté meats/seafood and vegetables in a paella pan.
Add rice, broth (with saffron), and simmer until liquid is absorbed and rice is cooked.

name: Pancakes
description: A flat cake, often thin and round, prepared from a batter and cooked on a hot surface.
pregnancy_benefit: A quick source of comfort and carbohydrates, especially for morning sickness. Top with fruit and yogurt instead of syrup for added nutrients.
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 tablespoon white sugar
1 1/4 cups milk
1 egg
3 tablespoons butter, melted
instructions_markdown:
Mix flour, eggs, milk, and leavening agents into a batter.
Pour batter onto a hot griddle and cook until bubbles form and edges are set.

name: Pastitsio
description: A Greek baked pasta dish with ground meat and a creamy Béchamel sauce, similar to lasagna.
pregnancy_benefit: A filling, high-calorie meal perfect for days needing maximum sustained energy. Provides Calcium and Iron.
ingredients:
1 pound tubular pasta (bucatini or penne)
1 pound ground beef
1/4 cup butter
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
3 cups whole milk
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
instructions_markdown:
Layer tubular pasta in a dish.
Top with ground meat in tomato sauce.
Cover with thick Béchamel sauce and bake until golden.

name: Peking Duck
description: A famous Chinese dish where duck is seasoned and roasted until the skin is crisp, typically served with thin pancakes and hoisin sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: Duck is a source of lean protein and Iron. The meat is served in small, manageable portions, which is good for mild appetite.
ingredients:
1 whole duck (4-5 pounds)
3 tablespoons honey
1 tablespoon soy sauce
12 thin mandarin pancakes
1/4 cup hoisin sauce
2 scallions, julienned
instructions_markdown:
Season and roast duck until skin is crisp.
Shred the duck meat.
Serve with thin pancakes, scallions, and hoisin sauce.

name: Philly Cheesesteak
description: A sandwich made from thinly sliced steak and melted cheese on a long hoagie roll.
pregnancy_benefit: High in Iron and Protein from the beef. Ensure the steak is cooked through, with no pink remaining.
ingredients:
1 hoagie roll
6 ounces thinly sliced ribeye steak
2 slices provolone cheese
1/2 small onion, sliced
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
instructions_markdown:
Thinly slice and griddle beef until cooked.
Place meat on a roll and top with melted cheese (Provolone or Cheez Whiz).

name: Pho
description: A popular Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat (usually beef or chicken).
pregnancy_benefit: Warm broth is great for hydration and soothing. Provides protein and complex carbs; excellent source of Folate from the fresh herbs.
ingredients:
4 cups beef bone broth
4 ounces rice sticks (noodles)
4 ounces thinly sliced beef eye round (fully cooked for pregnancy)
1/4 cup fresh bean sprouts
2 sprigs fresh Thai basil
1 tablespoon fish sauce
instructions_markdown:
Prepare beef or chicken bone broth.
Assemble bowl with cooked rice noodles, thin meat slices, and fresh herbs (basil, cilantro).

name: Pizza
description: A classic Italian dish of a round, flat base topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and various other ingredients.
pregnancy_benefit: Cheese is an easy source of Calcium and protein. Top with lots of veggies (peppers, mushrooms, spinach) to boost nutrition.
ingredients:
1 pound pizza dough
1/2 cup pizza sauce
2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup sliced pepperoni or mixed vegetables
instructions_markdown:
Spread sauce on dough.
Top with mozzarella and desired vegetables/meat.
Bake until crust is golden.

name: Pork Medallions in Mustard Sauce
description: Tender slices of pork tenderloin served in a creamy, tangy Dijon mustard sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: Pork tenderloin is one of the leanest meats, offering high protein and B vitamins with minimal fat.
ingredients:
1/2 pound pork tenderloin, sliced into 1-inch medallions
2 tablespoons Dijon mustard
1/4 cup heavy cream
1/4 cup chicken broth
1 tablespoon olive oil
instructions_markdown:
Pan-sear pork medallions until golden and cooked through.
Deglaze the pan and prepare the sauce with Dijon mustard and light cream.
Return pork to the pan to coat.

name: Pork Stroganoff
description: Tender strips of pork and mushrooms served in a creamy sauce, typically over rice or noodles.
pregnancy_benefit: A rich source of B vitamins from the pork, which supports energy levels. Serve with whole-grain rice or noodles.
ingredients:
1 pound pork loin, sliced into strips
8 ounces sliced mushrooms
1 cup sour cream
1 cup beef or chicken broth
1/2 pound egg noodles
instructions_markdown:
Sauté pork strips and mushrooms.
Prepare sauce with broth and light sour cream.
Combine and serve over rice or egg noodles.

name: Prime Rib
description: A large, slow-roasted cut of beef rib that is highly flavorful and tender.
pregnancy_benefit: An excellent source of highly bioavailable Iron, B12, and Zinc. Ensure any cut of beef is cooked to at least medium (no rare/bloody cuts).
ingredients:
6 pound standing beef rib roast
1/4 cup olive oil
2 tablespoons kosher salt
1 tablespoon cracked black pepper
4 cloves garlic, minced
instructions_markdown:
Season the rib roast generously.
Roast at a low temperature until desired doneness is reached.

name: Ravioli
description: Square pasta envelopes filled with cheese, meat, or vegetables, usually served with a light sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: Cheese-filled ravioli is a good source of Calcium and protein. Serve with a light tomato sauce instead of heavy cream.
ingredients:
1 package (16 oz) frozen cheese ravioli
2 cups marinara sauce
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 teaspoon dried basil
instructions_markdown:
Cook ravioli according to package directions.
Toss with butter and herbs or a simple marinara sauce.

name: Risotto
description: A creamy, Northern Italian rice dish cooked with broth until it reaches a thick consistency.
pregnancy_benefit: A hearty dish that is easy to digest. Can be boosted with vegetables like spinach or peas for Folate and served with lean protein.
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups Arborio rice
5 cups warm chicken or vegetable broth
1/2 cup dry white wine (optional)
2 tablespoons butter
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 small onion, finely diced
instructions_markdown:
Sauté Arborio rice with onions.
Slowly add warm broth, stirring constantly until the rice is creamy and tender.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and butter.

name: Salisbury Steak
description: A dish made from ground beef patty and seasonings, often served with gravy and mashed potatoes.
pregnancy_benefit: Provides high Iron and Protein. Use lean ground beef and pair with a side of steamed green vegetables for balance.
ingredients:
1 pound lean ground beef
1/4 cup breadcrumbs
1 can (10.5 oz) condensed French onion soup
1 tablespoon ketchup
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
instructions_markdown:
Form and pan-fry ground beef patties.
Prepare a brown mushroom gravy in the same pan.
Serve patties smothered in gravy.

name: Salmon
description: A fillet of salmon prepared simply, such as baked or pan-seared.
pregnancy_benefit: Exceptional source of Omega-3 fatty acids (DHA/EPA), critical for the development of baby's brain and vision. Also rich in Vitamin D.
ingredients:
6 ounce salmon fillet
1 tablespoon olive oil
1/2 lemon, sliced
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions_markdown:
Season salmon fillet with salt, pepper, and lemon.
Bake, grill, or pan-sear until it flakes easily.

name: Sausage Casserole
description: A hearty baked dish combining cooked sausage, baked beans, and vegetables in a savory sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: Sausage provides protein, while the beans are high in Fiber and Folate. Choose low-sodium or turkey sausage to reduce fat and sodium.
ingredients:
1 pound Italian sausage links, sliced
1 can (15 oz) baked beans
1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
1 bell pepper, chopped
1 onion, diced
instructions_markdown:
Brown sausage and combine with baked beans, diced tomatoes, and seasonings.
Bake until bubbly and heated through.

name: Scallops
description: Tender, pan-seared scallops, often served with a light butter and wine sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: An excellent source of lean protein, Vitamin B12, and Omega-3s. Scallops are considered a low-mercury shellfish.
ingredients:
6 large sea scallops
1 tablespoon butter
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 clove garlic, minced
Salt and lemon juice to taste
instructions_markdown:
Pat scallops dry and season.
Sear in butter or oil until a crust forms and they are cooked through.
Serve immediately.

name: Shepherd's Pie
description: A comforting casserole with a layer of cooked ground meat (or lentils) topped with a mashed potato crust.
pregnancy_benefit: A complete comfort food providing protein, iron, and carbohydrates for sustained energy. Incorporate hidden vegetables (peas, carrots) for vitamins.
ingredients:
1 pound ground lamb or beef
2 cups mashed potatoes
1 cup frozen peas and carrots
1 cup beef broth
1 tablespoon tomato paste
instructions_markdown:
Cook ground meat/lentils and vegetables in gravy.
Top with a layer of mashed potatoes.
Bake until potato is browned.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, hard cheese (Pecorino Romano or Parmesan), cured pork (Guanciale or bacon), and black pepper.
pregnancy_benefit: High in protein and carbohydrates for energy. Ensure the sauce is cooked until thick and hot to minimize risk from raw egg.
ingredients:
1/2 pound spaghetti
2 large eggs
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
4 ounces pancetta or bacon, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
instructions_markdown:
Cook pasta and cured pork until crisp.
Whisk eggs and cheese.
Toss hot pasta with egg/cheese mixture and pork to form a creamy sauce.

name: Spicy Beef Stir Fry
description: Tender beef slices stir-fried quickly with vegetables in a spicy Asian-inspired sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: Provides high levels of Iron and Zinc from the beef. Serve over brown rice and include a variety of vegetables for fiber.
ingredients:
1 pound flank steak, thinly sliced
2 cups broccoli florets
1 red bell pepper, sliced
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon Sriracha or chili sauce
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
instructions_markdown:
Slice and marinate beef.
Stir-fry vegetables until crisp-tender.
Add beef and spicy sauce; cook quickly until beef is done.

name: Spicy Thai Egg Salad
description: Hard-boiled eggs tossed in a dressing of chili, lime juice, fish sauce, and herbs.
pregnancy_benefit: High in Choline and Protein from the eggs. The lime juice and herbs provide a refreshing flavor; adjust chili to taste.
ingredients:
3 hard-boiled eggs, sliced
2 tablespoons lime juice
1 tablespoon fish sauce
1 teaspoon sugar
1 Thai bird's eye chili, minced
1/4 cup fresh cilantro
instructions_markdown:
Slice hard-boiled eggs.
Whisk together lime juice, fish sauce, chilies, and sugar/sweetener.
Toss eggs, sliced onions, and cilantro with the dressing.

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken
description: Chicken breasts stuffed with a mixture of fresh spinach and salty feta cheese, then baked.
pregnancy_benefit: A lean, nutrient-dense meal high in Protein and Folate (from spinach). Feta provides calcium.
ingredients:
2 chicken breasts
1 cup fresh spinach, chopped
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
1 tablespoon olive oil
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
instructions_markdown:
Slice a pocket into chicken breasts.
Stuff with a mixture of cooked spinach and feta cheese.
Bake until chicken is fully cooked.

name: Spinach Beef Soup
description: A light but satisfying broth-based soup featuring small pieces of beef and a large amount of spinach.
pregnancy_benefit: A highly hydrating dish, providing easily digestible Iron from the beef and Folate from the spinach.
ingredients:
1/2 pound beef stew meat, cut into small cubes
4 cups beef broth
4 cups fresh baby spinach
1 large potato, cubed
1 carrot, sliced
instructions_markdown:
Simmer beef in broth until tender.
Add potatoes or other vegetables.
Stir in a large amount of fresh spinach right before serving.

name: Steak Diane
description: Thin, pan-fried beef steak served with a rich sauce made from the pan juices, typically mustard, shallots, and cream.
pregnancy_benefit: Steak is essential for Iron intake. Ensure the steak is cooked to at least medium-well (or well-done) to minimize any food safety risk.
ingredients:
2 thin beef tenderloin cutlets (4 oz each)
1/4 cup heavy cream
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
1 shallot, finely minced
1 tablespoon butter
instructions_markdown:
Pan-fry the thin steak quickly.
Prepare the sauce using pan drippings, shallots, Dijon, and cream.
Serve steak smothered in sauce.

name: Steamed Fish Ginger Soy Sauce
description: A whole or filleted fish gently steamed with ginger and scallions, then drizzled with hot soy sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: One of the healthiest ways to consume lean protein and Omega-3s. Ginger is known to help soothe nausea.
ingredients:
1 pound white fish fillet (tilapia or snapper)
2 tablespoons fresh ginger, julienned
2 scallions, sliced
3 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon sesame oil
instructions_markdown:
Place fish on a plate with ginger and scallions.
Steam until the fish is cooked through.
Drizzle with hot oil and soy sauce before serving.

name: Strawberry Shortcake
description: A sweet biscuit or sponge cake topped with fresh strawberries and whipped cream.
pregnancy_benefit: Strawberries are an excellent source of Vitamin C and Folate. A light, refreshing way to satisfy a sweet tooth.
ingredients:
1 quart fresh strawberries, sliced
2 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 cup white sugar
1 cup heavy whipping cream
1/2 cup butter, cold and cubed
instructions_markdown:
Bake or prepare shortcake/biscuits.
Slice strawberries and mix with a little sugar.
Assemble by topping the cake with berries and whipped cream.

name: Tacos
description: Folded or rolled corn or wheat tortillas filled with various ingredients like seasoned meat, beans, and fresh toppings.
pregnancy_benefit: A versatile food: the corn tortilla offers Folate, and fresh toppings (like avocado and salsa) provide healthy fats and Vitamin C.
ingredients:
1 pound lean ground beef or black beans
12 corn tortillas
1 cup shredded lettuce
1/2 cup shredded cheese
1/2 cup fresh salsa
instructions_markdown:
Cook and season ground meat or beans.
Warm tortillas.
Assemble tacos with filling and desired toppings (lettuce, cheese, salsa).

name: Thai Green Curry
description: A fragrant, spicy Thai curry made with coconut milk, green curry paste, and vegetables/meat.
pregnancy_benefit: Coconut milk provides healthy fats, and the added vegetables contribute various vitamins. Serve with brown rice to increase fiber.
ingredients:
1 pound chicken breast, sliced
1 can (13.5 oz) coconut milk
2 tablespoons green curry paste
1 cup bamboo shoots
1/2 cup fresh Thai basil leaves
instructions_markdown:
Sauté green curry paste in oil.
Add coconut milk, vegetables, and chicken/tofu and simmer until cooked.
Serve with steamed rice.

name: Thai Pineapple Fried Rice
description: Fried rice mixed with curry powder, raisins, cashews, and often served inside a hollowed-out pineapple.
pregnancy_benefit: Pineapple contains Bromelain (a digestive aid) and Vitamin C. Use cashews in moderation, or omit if nut-free is necessary.
ingredients:
2 cups cooked jasmine rice, chilled
1 cup fresh pineapple chunks
1/4 cup roasted cashews
1 tablespoon curry powder
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1/4 cup golden raisins
instructions_markdown:
Stir-fry rice with egg, vegetables, meat (optional), and curry powder.
Stir in pineapple chunks and cashews.
Serve inside a hollowed-out pineapple half.

name: Tom Kha Gai
description: A creamy, slightly sour Thai soup made with coconut milk, chicken, galangal, lemongrass, and mushrooms.
pregnancy_benefit: Coconut milk provides healthy fats, and the ginger/galangal is excellent for soothing nausea. Chicken is a source of lean protein.
ingredients:
1 can (13.5 oz) coconut milk
1/2 pound chicken breast, sliced
2 cups chicken broth
1 stalk lemongrass, bruised
1 inch galangal or ginger, sliced
1 cup straw mushrooms
instructions_markdown:
Simmer chicken in coconut milk with galangal, lemongrass, and kaffir lime leaves.
Add fish sauce, mushrooms, and lime juice.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro.

name: Tom Yum Goong
description: A hot and sour Thai soup with shrimp (Goong) and fragrant herbs like lemongrass and galangal.
pregnancy_benefit: Shrimp is a lean protein source. The broth is hydrating, and the herbs are anti-inflammatory. Go easy on the chili if sensitive to spice.
ingredients:
1/2 pound medium shrimp, peeled
4 cups water or light shrimp stock
1 stalk lemongrass
3 kaffir lime leaves
1 cup mushrooms
2 tablespoons lime juice
instructions_markdown:
Bring broth to a boil with lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves.
Add shrimp and mushrooms; cook until shrimp are pink.
Stir in fish sauce, lime juice, and chili paste.

name: Tomato and Garlic Butter Bean Dinner
description: Creamy white beans simmered in a rich tomato and garlic sauce, perfect with crusty bread.
pregnancy_benefit: An excellent source of plant-based Protein, Iron, and Fiber, which helps manage blood sugar and prevent constipation.
ingredients:
2 cans (15 oz) butter beans, rinsed
1 can (14.5 oz) crushed tomatoes
4 cloves garlic, minced
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 teaspoon dried thyme
instructions_markdown:
Sauté garlic and herbs.
Add canned crushed tomatoes and canned butter beans (rinsed).
Simmer until the sauce thickens; serve with fresh herbs.

name: Vegetarian Sausage Casserole
description: A hearty baked dish combining vegetarian sausages, baked beans, and vegetables in a savory sauce.
pregnancy_benefit: A filling source of plant-based Protein and high levels of Fiber and Folate from the beans.
ingredients:
1 package (12 oz) vegetarian sausage links, sliced
1 can (15 oz) baked beans
1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
1 small zucchini, sliced
1 small onion, chopped
instructions_markdown:
Brown vegetarian sausage and combine with baked beans, diced tomatoes, and seasonings.
Bake until bubbly and heated through.

name: Waffles
description: Crisp, leavened batter cooked between two plates that are patterned to give a characteristic size, shape, and surface impression.
pregnancy_benefit: A quick source of carbohydrates for morning sickness. Top with eggs/fruit/yogurt instead of syrup to boost protein and fiber.
ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 3/4 cups milk
2 large eggs
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1 tablespoon white sugar
4 teaspoons baking powder
instructions_markdown:
Mix dry ingredients (flour, baking powder).
Mix wet ingredients (milk, eggs, butter).
Combine and cook in a hot waffle iron.

name: White Bean and Sausage Soup
description: A hearty, rustic soup featuring cannellini beans, kale, and slices of savory Italian sausage.
pregnancy_benefit: Beans provide Folate and Fiber, while the sausage adds flavor and protein. A warming meal that is easy on the stomach.
ingredients:
1 pound Italian sausage, sliced
2 cans (15 oz) cannellini beans, rinsed
1 bunch kale, stemmed and chopped
6 cups chicken broth
2 carrots, sliced
1 onion, diced
instructions_markdown:
Brown sausage and set aside.
Sauté vegetables (onion, celery, carrots).
Add broth, white beans, and sausage; simmer until flavors meld.
Stir in kale at the end.
